oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Obion Cooperage Company
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front of Obion Cooperage Company. Shown is a team of four oxen pulling a heavy wagon. There are men and boys with the team.

In 1911 Hilt Forcum founded the Obion Cooperage Co. Inc. in Obion, Tennessee. Three years later, in 1914 it became the Forcum-James Co. The firm engaged in the business of retail building materials and house construction. In the thirties, the construction business was expanded to a multi-state highway and flood control con-struction operation.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Carts & wagons; Animal teams; Ox teams
